page.title: 06RAILWAY LINE NR. WOMERSLEY.
page.content: The railway line runs North-South through the area, passing close to Womersley,which has two level crossings and one small signal box. The signal master as been working on the railway for eight years. He doesn't have to travel far from his home to get to work as he lives near by. No other members of his famiy are employed in the train industry. To become a train master you don't need lots of qualifications, you are trained on how to switch lines and that is all. There are a variety of cargoes that pass through, but most are carrying stone or coal. On average, nine passenger trains pass per week. The trains are not allowed to stop to load or unload their cargoes because there is no station.
